# selectItem(withObjectValue:)

**Instance Method**

Selects the first pop-up list item that corresponds to the given object.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func selectItem(withObjectValue object: Any?)
```

## Parameters

- **object**: The object to select in the pop-up list.  Objects are considered equal if they have the same id or if `isEqual:` returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Discussion

This method logs a warning if [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSComboBox/usesDataSource] returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. Posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSComboBox/selectionDidChangeNotification] to the default notification center if the selection does in fact change. Note that this method doesn’t alter the contents of the combo box’s text field—see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/ComboBox/Tasks/SettingComboBoxValue.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20000256] for more information.

## Related Documentation

- **objectValue**: The value of the receiver’s cell as an Objective-C object.

## Manipulating the Selection

- **deselectItem(at:)**: Deselects the pop-up list item at the specified index if it’s selected.
- **indexOfSelectedItem**: The index of the last item selected from the pop-up list.
- **objectValueOfSelectedItem**: The object corresponding to the last item selected from the pop-up list.
- **selectItem(at:)**: Selects the pop-up list row at the given index.
